title: Gapminder Data Analysis
text:
Gapminder Data Analysis
The Gapminder dataset contains information on life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for 142 countries between 1952 and 2007.

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population
Country Analysis

title: Country Analysis
text:
Country Analysis
This page analyzes life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for a selected country.


Filter data for a specific country (e.g., Japan)
country_data = gapminder_df[gapminder_df[‘country’] == ‘Japan’]


Plot the changes over time
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6)) plt.plot(country_data[‘year’], country_data[‘life_expectancy’], label=‘Life Expectancy’) plt.plot(country_data[‘year’], country_data[‘gdp_per_capita’], label=‘GDP per Capita’) plt.plot(country_data[‘year’], country_data[‘population_millions’], label=‘Population (millions)’) plt.title(‘Changes in Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population for Japan’) plt.xlabel(‘Year’) plt.legend() plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
Life Expectancy and Population
This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and population using the Gapminder dataset.


Plot the relationship between life expectancy and population
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6)) plt.scatter(gapminder_df[‘population_millions’], gapminder_df[‘life_expectancy’]) plt.title(‘Life Expectancy vs Population’) plt.xlabel(‘Population (millions)’) plt.ylabel(‘Life Expectancy’) plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP
text:
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using the Gapminder dataset.
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt


Load the Gapminder dataset
gapminder_df = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)


Plot the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6)) plt.scatter(gapminder_df[‘gdp_per_capita’], gapminder_df[‘life_expectancy’]) plt.title(‘Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita’) plt.xlabel(‘GDP per Capita’) plt.ylabel(‘Life Expectancy’) plt.show()
